channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-3974] netty4 endpoint does not work on Fuse on EAP with IBM JDK
item.description:
Cannot deploy application with route with netty4 endpoint to Fuse on EAP with IBM JDK.
Probably because of sun.misc.Unsafe class is missing.

item.environment:
jboss-eap-6.4.1
fuse-eap-installer-6.2.1.redhat-020.jar
IBM J9 VM (build 2.7, JRE 1.7.0 Linux x86-32 20150407_243189
item.summary: netty4 endpoint does not work on Fuse on EAP with IBM JDK

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Hi Thomas,
It's fixable by 'modules/system/layers/fuse/io/netty/4.0/module.xml' and this is fuse's file (workaround description). I think that we can fix it in fuse 6.2.1.

Is the module sun.jdk available on IBM J9 VM?
And if it is, does it contain sun.misc.Unsafe?

I suppose you've tested this, have you?

Yes, It's here (alsi in IBM java) : jre/lib/rt.jar#sun/misc/Unsafe.class .

I have tested this workaround just with IBM J9 VM on RHEL6 x86:
[hudson@dev88 main]$ /qa/tools/opt/ibm-java-70/bin/java -version
java version "1.7.0"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build pxi3270_27sr3-20150415_01(SR3))
IBM J9 VM (build 2.7, JRE 1.7.0 Linux x86-32 20150407_243189 (JIT enabled, AOT enabled)
J9VM - R27_Java727_SR3_20150407_1831_B243189
JIT - tr.r13.java_20150406_89182
GC - R27_Java727_SR3_20150407_1831_B243189
J9CL - 20150407_243189)
JCL - 20150414_01 based on Oracle 7u79-b14

I have been inspired by this:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/31535350/wildfly-8-2-classnotfoundexception-sun-misc-unsafe-from-module-io-nettymain-w
ok, thanks for following up on this.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Deploy application with route with netty4 endpoint to Fuse on EAP using IBM JDK.

edit modules/system/layers/fuse/io/netty/4.0/module.xml:
replace

<dependencies/>

with replacement

    <dependencies>
 
        <module name="sun.jdk" export="true" >
 
            <imports>
 
                <include path="sun/misc/Unsafe" />
 
            </imports>
 
        </module>
 
    </dependencies>
